00051 
00052 struct xed_encoder_vars_s;
00053 struct xed_decoder_vars_s;
00054 
00055 /// @ingroup DEC
00056 /// The main container for instructions. After decode, it holds an array of
00057 /// operands with derived information from decode and also valid
00058 /// #xed_inst_t pointer which describes the operand templates and the
00059 /// operand order.  See @ref DEC for API documentation.
00060 typedef struct XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_decoded_inst_s  {
00061     /// The operand storage fields discovered during decoding. This same array is used by encode.
00062     xed_operand_values_t _operands[XED_OPERAND_LAST]; // FIXME: can further squeeze down 16b units
00063 
00064     /// Used for encode operand ordering. Not set by decode.
00065     xed_uint8_t _operand_order[XED_ENCODE_ORDER_MAX_OPERANDS];
00066 
00067     xed_uint8_t _decoded_length;
00068     // Length of the _operand_order[] array.
00069     xed_uint8_t _n_operand_order; 
00070 
00071     /// when we decode an instruction, we set the _inst and get the
00072     /// properites of that instruction here. This also points to the
00073     /// operands template array.
00074     const xed_inst_t* _inst;
00075 
00076     // decoder does not change it, encoder does    
00077     union {
00078         xed_uint8_t* _enc;
00079         const xed_uint8_t* _dec;
00080     } _byte_array; 
00081 
00082     // These are stack allocated by xed_encode() or xed_decode(). These are
00083     // per-encode or per-decode transitory data.
00084     union {
00085 
00086         /* user_data is available as a user data storage field after
00087          * decoding. It does not live across re-encodes or re-decodes. */
00088         xed_uint64_t user_data; 
00089         struct xed_decoder_vars_s* dv;
00090         struct xed_encoder_vars_s* ev;
00091     } u;
00092 
00093 
00094     
00095 } xed_decoded_inst_t;
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t Operands array access
00100 //@{
00101 /// @ingroup DEC
00102 /// Obtain a constant pointer to the operands
00103 static XED_INLINE const xed_operand_values_t* 
00104 xed_decoded_inst_operands_const(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00105     return STATIC_CAST(xed_operand_values_t*,p->_operands);
00106 }
00107 /// @ingroup DEC
00108 /// Obtain a non-constant pointer to the operands
00109 static XED_INLINE xed_operand_values_t* 
00110 xed_decoded_inst_operands(xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00111     return STATIC_CAST(xed_operand_values_t*,p->_operands);
00112 }
00113 //@}
00114 
00115 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t Initialization
00116 //@{
00117 /// @ingroup DEC
00118 /// Zero the decode structure, but set the machine state/mode information
00119 XED_DLL_EXPORT void  xed_decoded_inst_zero_set_mode(xed_decoded_inst_t* p, const xed_state_t* dstate);
00120 /// @ingroup DEC
00121 /// Zero the decode structure, but preserve the existing machine state/mode information
00122 XED_DLL_EXPORT void  xed_decoded_inst_zero_keep_mode(xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00123 /// @ingroup DEC
00124 /// Zero the decode structure completely.
00125 XED_DLL_EXPORT void  xed_decoded_inst_zero(xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00126 /// @ingroup DEC
00127 /// set the machine mode and stack addressing width directly
00128 static XED_INLINE void  xed_decoded_inst_set_mode(xed_decoded_inst_t* p,
00129                                                   xed_machine_mode_enum_t mmode,
00130                                                   xed_address_width_enum_t stack_addr_width) {
00131     xed_state_t dstate;
00132     dstate.mmode = mmode;
00133     dstate.stack_addr_width = stack_addr_width;
00134     xed_operand_values_init_set_mode(p->_operands, &dstate);
00135 }
00136 
00137 
00138 
00139 /// @ingroup DEC
00140 /// Zero the decode structure, but copy the existing machine state/mode information from the supplied operands pointer. Same as #xed_decoded_inst_zero_keep_mode.
00141 XED_DLL_EXPORT void  xed_decoded_inst_zero_keep_mode_from_operands(xed_decoded_inst_t* p,
00142                                                                    const xed_operand_values_t* operands);
00143 // Set an arbitrary field
00144 /// @ingroup DEC
00145 XED_DLL_EXPORT void xed_decoded_inst_set_operand_storage_field(xed_decoded_inst_t* p,
00146                                                                xed_operand_enum_t operand_name,  
00147                                                                xed_uint32_t value);
00148 
00149 //@}

00151 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t Length 
00152 //@{
00153 /// @ingroup DEC
00154 /// Return the length of the decoded  instruction in bytes.
00155 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00156 xed_decoded_inst_get_length(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {  
00157     return p->_decoded_length;
00158 }

00163 /// @name Modes
00164 //@{
00165 /// @ingroup DEC
00166 /// Returns 16/32/64 indicating the machine mode with in bits. This is
00167 /// derived from the input mode information.
00168 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_decoded_inst_get_machine_mode_bits(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00169     if (p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_MODE] == 2) return 64;
00170     if (p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_MODE] == 1) return 32;
00171     return 16;
00172 }
00173 /// @ingroup DEC
00174 /// Returns 16/32/64 indicating the stack addressing mode with in
00175 /// bits. This is derived from the input mode information.
00176 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_decoded_inst_get_stack_address_mode_bits(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00177     if (p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_SMODE] == 2) return 64;
00178     if (p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_SMODE] == 1) return 32;
00179     return 16;
00180 }
00181 
00182 /// Returns the operand width in bits: 8/16/32/64. This is different than
00183 /// the #xed_operand_values_get_effective_operand_width() which only
00184 /// returns 16/32/64. This factors in the BYTEOP attribute when computing
00185 /// its return value. This is a convenience function.
00186 /// @ingroup DEC
00187 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint32_t xed_decoded_inst_get_operand_width(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00188 
00189 /// Return the user-specified #xed_chip_enum_t chip name, or XED_CHIP_INVALID if not set.
00190 /// @ingroup DEC
00191 static XED_INLINE xed_chip_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_input_chip(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00192     return STATIC_CAST(xed_chip_enum_t,p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_CHIP]);
00193 }
00194 
00195 /// Set a user-specified #xed_chip_enum_t chip name for restricting decode
00196 /// @ingroup DEC
00197 static XED_INLINE void xed_decoded_inst_set_input_chip(xed_decoded_inst_t* p,  xed_chip_enum_t chip) {
00198     p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_CHIP] = chip;
00199 }
00200 //@}

00207 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t High-level accessors
00208 //@{
00209 /// @ingroup DEC
00210 /// Return true if the instruction is valid
00211 static XED_INLINE xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_valid(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p ) {
00212     return STATIC_CAST(xed_bool_t,(p->_inst != 0));
00213 }
00214 /// @ingroup DEC
00215 /// Return the #xed_inst_t structure for this instruction. This is the route to the basic operands form information.
00216 static XED_INLINE const xed_inst_t* xed_decoded_inst_inst( const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00217     return p->_inst;
00218 }
00219 
00220 
00221 /// @ingroup DEC
00222 /// Return the instruction #xed_category_enum_t enumeration
00223 static XED_INLINE xed_category_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_category(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00224     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00225     return xed_inst_category(p->_inst);
00226 }
00227 /// @ingroup DEC
00228 /// Return the instruction #xed_extension_enum_t enumeration
00229 static XED_INLINE xed_extension_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_extension( const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00230     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00231     return xed_inst_extension(p->_inst);
00232 }
00233 /// @ingroup DEC
00234 /// Return the instruction #xed_isa_set_enum_t enumeration
00235 static XED_INLINE xed_isa_set_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_isa_set( const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00236     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00237     return xed_inst_isa_set(p->_inst);
00238 }
00239 /// @ingroup DEC
00240 /// Return the instruction #xed_iclass_enum_t enumeration.
00241 static XED_INLINE xed_iclass_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_iclass( const xed_decoded_inst_t* p){
00242     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00243     return xed_inst_iclass(p->_inst);
00244 }
00245 
00246 /// @ingroup DEC
00247 /// Returns 1 if the attribute is defined for this instruction.
00248 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint32_t xed_decoded_inst_get_attribute(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, xed_attribute_enum_t attr);
00249 
00250 /// @ingroup DEC
00251 /// Returns the attribute bitvector
00252 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint64_t xed_decoded_inst_get_attributes(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00253 //@}

00255 
00256 /// @name IFORM handling
00257 //@{
00258 
00259 /// @ingroup DEC
00260 /// Return the instruction iform enum of type #xed_iform_enum_t .
00261 static XED_INLINE xed_iform_enum_t xed_decoded_inst_get_iform_enum(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00262     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00263     return xed_inst_iform_enum(p->_inst);
00264 }
00265 
00266 /// @ingroup DEC
00267 /// Return the instruction zero-based iform number based on masking the
00268 /// corresponding #xed_iform_enum_t. This value is suitable for
00269 /// dispatching. The maximum value for a particular iclass is provided by
00270 /// #xed_iform_max_per_iclass() .
00271 static XED_INLINE unsigned int xed_decoded_inst_get_iform_enum_dispatch(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00272     xed_assert(p->_inst != 0);
00273     return xed_inst_iform_enum(p->_inst) - xed_iform_first_per_iclass(xed_inst_iclass(p->_inst));
00274 }
00275 //@}

00290 ///  @ingroup DEC

00296 /// Return the number of operands
00297 /// @ingroup DEC
00298 static XED_INLINE unsigned int  xed_decoded_inst_noperands(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00299     unsigned int noperands = xed_inst_noperands(xed_decoded_inst_inst(p));
00300     return noperands;
00301 }

00304 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t Printers
00305 //@{
00306 /// @ingroup DEC
00307 /// Print out all the information about the decoded instruction to the buffer buf whose length is maximally buflen.
00308 XED_DLL_EXPORT void xed_decoded_inst_dump(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, char* buf,  int buflen);
00309 
00310 /// @ingroup DEC
00311 /// Print the instructions with the destination on the left. Use PTR qualifiers for memory access widths.
00312 /// Recommendation: buflen must be more than 16 bytes, preferably at least 100 bytes.
00313 /// @param p a #xed_decoded_inst_t for a decoded instruction
00314 /// @param buf a buffer to write the disassembly in to.
00315 /// @param buflen maximum length of the disassembly buffer
00316 /// @param runtime_address the address of the instruction being disassembled. If zero, the offset is printed for relative branches. If nonzero, XED attempts to print the target address for relative branches.
00317 /// @return Returns 0 if the disassembly fails, 1 otherwise.
00318 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_dump_intel_format(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, 
00319                                                              char* buf, 
00320                                                              int buflen, 
00321                                                              xed_uint64_t runtime_address);
00322 /// @ingroup DEC
00323 /// Print the instructions with the destination on the left. Use PTR qualifiers for memory access widths.
00324 /// Recommendation: buflen must be more than 16 bytes, preferably at least 100 bytes.
00325 /// @param p a #xed_decoded_inst_t for a decoded instruction
00326 /// @param buf a buffer to write the disassembly in to.
00327 /// @param buflen maximum length of the disassembly buffer
00328 /// @param runtime_address the address of the instruction being disassembled. If zero, the offset is printed for relative branches. If nonzero, XED attempts to print the target address for relative branches.
00329 /// @param context A void* used only for the call back routine for symbolic disassembly if one is registered.
00330 /// @return Returns 0 if the disassembly fails, 1 otherwise.
00331 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_dump_intel_format_context(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, 
00332                                                                      char* buf, 
00333                                                                      int buflen, 
00334                                                                      xed_uint64_t runtime_address,
00335                                                                      void* context);
00336 
00337 /// @ingroup DEC
00338 /// Print the instructions with the destination operand on the right, with
00339 /// several exceptions (bound, invlpga, enter, and other instructions with
00340 /// two immediate operands).  Also use instruction name suffixes to
00341 /// indicate operation width. Several instructions names are different as
00342 /// well. 
00343 /// Recommendation: buflen must be more than 16 bytes, preferably at least 100 bytes.
00344 /// @param p a #xed_decoded_inst_t for a decoded instruction
00345 /// @param buf a buffer to write the disassembly in to.
00346 /// @param buflen maximum length of the disassembly buffer
00347 /// @param runtime_address the address of the instruction being disassembled. If zero, the offset is printed for relative branches. If nonzero, XED attempts to print the target address for relative branches.
00348 /// @return Returns 0 if the disassembly fails, 1 otherwise.
00349 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_dump_att_format(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, 
00350                                                            char* buf, 
00351                                                            int buflen, 
00352                                                            xed_uint64_t runtime_address);
00353 
00354 /// @ingroup DEC
00355 /// Print the instructions with the destination operand on the right, with
00356 /// several exceptions (bound, invlpga, enter, and other instructions with
00357 /// two immediate operands).  Also use instruction name suffixes to
00358 /// indicate operation width. Several instructions names are different as
00359 /// well. buflen must be at least 100 bytes.
00360 /// @param p a #xed_decoded_inst_t for a decoded instruction
00361 /// @param buf a buffer to write the disassembly in to.
00362 /// @param buflen maximum length of the disassembly buffer
00363 /// @param runtime_address the address of the instruction being disassembled. If zero, the offset is printed for relative branches. If nonzero, XED attempts to print the target address for relative branches.
00364 /// @param context A void* used only for the call back routine for symbolic disassembly if one is registered.
00365 /// @return Returns 0 if the disassembly fails, 1 otherwise.
00366 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_dump_att_format_context(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, 
00367                                                                    char* buf, 
00368                                                                    int buflen, 
00369                                                                    xed_uint64_t runtime_address,
00370                                                                    void* context);
00371 
00372 /// @ingroup DEC
00373 /// @param p a #xed_decoded_inst_t for a decoded instruction
00374 /// @param buf a buffer to write the disassembly in to.
00375 /// @param buflen maximum length of the disassembly buffer
00376 /// @param runtime_address the address of the instruction being disassembled. If zero, the offset is printed for relative branches. If nonzero, XED attempts to print the target address for relative branches.
00377 /// @return Returns 0 if the disassembly fails, 1 otherwise.
00378 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_dump_xed_format(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p,
00379                                                            char* buf, 
00380                                                            int buflen, xed_uint64_t runtime_address) ;
00381 //@}

00423 static XED_INLINE xed_uint8_t xed_decoded_inst_get_second_immediate(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00424     return STATIC_CAST(xed_uint8_t,p->_operands[XED_OPERAND_UIMM1]);
00425 }

00435 /// See the comment on xed_decoded_inst_uses_rflags(). This can return 
00436 /// 0 if the flags are really not used by this instruction.
00437 /// @ingroup DEC
00438 XED_DLL_EXPORT const xed_simple_flag_t* xed_decoded_inst_get_rflags_info( const xed_decoded_inst_t* p );
00439 
00440 /// This returns 1 if the flags are read or written. This will return 0
00441 /// otherwise. This will return 0 if the flags are really not used by this
00442 /// instruction. For some shifts/rotates, XED puts a flags operand in the
00443 /// operand array before it knows if the flags are used because of
00444 /// mode-dependent masking effects on the immediate. 
00445 /// @ingroup DEC
00446 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_uses_rflags(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00447 /// @ingroup DEC
00448 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_decoded_inst_number_of_memory_operands(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00449 /// @ingroup DEC
00450 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_mem_read(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, unsigned int mem_idx);
00451 /// @ingroup DEC
00452 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_mem_written(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, unsigned int mem_idx);
00453 /// @ingroup DEC
00454 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_mem_written_only(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, unsigned int mem_idx);
00455 /// @ingroup DEC
00456 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_conditionally_writes_registers(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);
00457 /// @ingroup DEC
00458 XED_DLL_EXPORT unsigned int  xed_decoded_inst_get_memory_operand_length(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p, 
00459                                                                         unsigned int memop_idx);

00461 
00462 /// @ingroup DEC
00463 /// Returns true if the instruction is a prefetch
00464 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_decoded_inst_is_prefetch(const xed_decoded_inst_t* p);

00502 /// @name xed_decoded_inst_t User Data Field
00503 //@{
00504 /// @ingroup DEC
00505 /// Return a user data field for arbitrary use by the user after decoding.
00506 static XED_INLINE  xed_uint64_t xed_decoded_inst_get_user_data(xed_decoded_inst_t* p) {
00507     return p->u.user_data;
00508 }
00509 /// @ingroup DEC
00510 /// Modify the user data field.
00511 static XED_INLINE  void xed_decoded_inst_set_user_data(xed_decoded_inst_t* p, xed_uint64_t new_value) {
00512     p->u.user_data = new_value;
00513 }
